description: a(n) = largest m such that n-m and n+m are both primes, or -1 if no such m exists.
comments: A067076 is a subsequence of this sequence: when 2m+3 is prime a(m+3) = m. Moreover, it is the subsequence of records (maximal increasing subsequence): let m=a(n), with p=n-m and q=p+2m both odd primes > 3; now 3+2(m+(p-3)/2)=q and hence a(3+m+(p-3)/2) >= m+(p-3)/2 > m = a(n) but 3+m+(p-3)/2 < n. - _Jason Kimberley_, Aug 30 2012 and Oct 10 2012Goldbach's conjecture says a(n) >= 0 for all n. - _Robert Israel_, Apr 15 2015
